neighbors.name: Oowa
neighbors.claims: The Oklahoma Ordnance Works Authority (OOWA) is a public trust formed in 1960 that acquired the former ordnance plant land in Mayes County ([MidAmerica History](https://maip.com/about-midamerica/history/)). OOWA operates the MidAmerica Industrial Park (MAIP), the largest industrial park in Oklahoma, with a mission to promote industrial development and economic growth ([Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MidAmerica_Industrial_Park)). The Authority actively recruits advanced manufacturing and renewable energy partners, including electric vehicle manufacturer Canoo, and utilizes hydroelectric power from the Grand River Dam Authority ([InsideEVs](https://insideevs.com/news/620010/canoo-build-battery-module-manufacturing-facility-in-oklahoma/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Manages 9,000-acre industrial park; major economic driver

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage OOWA leadership through formal channels; emphasize how the project aligns with MidAmerica Industrial Parkâ€™s economic development goals and renewable energy initiatives.

citations.claim: The Oklahoma Ordnance Works Authority (OOWA) is a public trust formed in 1960 that acquired the former ordnance plant land in Mayes County
citations.title: MidAmerica Industrial Park History

citations.claim: OOWA operates the MidAmerica Industrial Park (MAIP), the largest industrial park in Oklahoma
citations.title: Wikipedia: MidAmerica Industrial Park

citations.claim: The Authority actively recruits advanced manufacturing and renewable energy partners... and utilizes hydroelectric power
citations.title: Canoo to Build Battery Module Manufacturing Facility in Oklahoma

neighbors.name: United States Of America
neighbors.claims: Parcels designated as 'United States of America' in Mayes County typically correspond to lands managed by the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE), specifically around reservoir boundaries such as Lake Hudson and the Grand River ([USACE Survey Plat](https://www.swt.usace.army.mil/Portals/41/docs/lakes/ftgibson/surveyplats/t19nr18e/SEC2T19NR18E.pdf)). The federal government previously owned the entirety of the Oklahoma Ordnance Works site before transferring portions to the OOWA in 1960 ([Grokipedia](https://grokipedia.com/page/oklahoma_ordnance_works)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Federal land management; limited local political engagement

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers Tulsa District office regarding any easement or boundary issues; standard federal land use protocols apply.

citations.claim: Parcels designated as 'United States of America' in Mayes County typically correspond to lands managed by the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers
citations.title: USACE Survey Plat Mayes County

citations.claim: The federal government previously owned the entirety of the Oklahoma Ordnance Works site before transferring portions to the OOWA in 1960
citations.title: Oklahoma Ordnance Works History

neighbors.name: Harris, Ila F & Lillian Tucker
neighbors.claims: Lillian Tucker is a resident of Mayes County who has served as a Library Assistant at the Thomas J. Harrison Pryor Public Library, receiving a promotion to full-time status in December 2020 ([City of Pryor Creek Minutes](https://www.pryorcreek.org/sites/g/files/vyhlif4896/f/agendas/cca_packet_20210105_1.pdf)). No public records were found regarding Ila F. Harris in local news or meeting minutes. Neither individual has a documented public stance on renewable energy development.
neighbors.influence_justification: Library staff member; no known political leadership role

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out personally to build rapport; acknowledge their long-standing presence in the community and emphasize respect for their land and privacy.

citations.claim: Lillian Tucker... served as a Library Assistant at the Thomas J. Harrison Pryor Public Library, receiving a promotion to full-time status in December 2020
citations.title: Minutes of City Council Meeting Pryor Creek

neighbors.name: Stoner, Larry Allen & Sarah Opdycke & Larry Opdycke
neighbors.claims: Larry Allen Stoner is a resident of Chouteau, Oklahoma, and the widower of Susan Katheleen Stoner, who passed away in February 2023 ([Shipman's Funeral Home](https://www.shipmansfuneralhome.com/obituaries/susan-stoner)). Sarah Opdycke is the daughter of Larry and Susan Stoner; she and her husband, Larry Opdycke, reside in Seneca, South Carolina ([Obituary](https://www.shipmansfuneralhome.com/obituaries/susan-stoner)). The property ownership structure likely reflects this family relationship. No evidence of public participation in zoning or development meetings was found for any of the owners.
neighbors.influence_justification: Private family landowners; partial out-of-state ownership

approach_recommendations.engage: Arrange a meeting that accommodates the out-of-state owners (Sarah and Larry Opdycke) if possible, or coordinate through Larry Stoner in Chouteau; acknowledge the family legacy and recent loss.

citations.claim: Larry Allen Stoner is a resident of Chouteau, Oklahoma, and the widower of Susan Katheleen Stoner, who passed away in February 2023
citations.title: Obituary for Susan Katheleen Stoner

citations.claim: Sarah Opdycke is the daughter of Larry and Susan Stoner; she and her husband, Larry Opdycke, reside in Seneca, South Carolina
citations.title: Obituary for Susan Katheleen Stoner
